Title: Two Weeks Notice
Description: A 2002 American romantic comedy film starring Hugh Grant and Sandra Bullock.

Genre.Name: Romantic Comedy
Genre.Description: Romantic comedy (also known as romcom or rom-com) is a subgenre of comedy and slice-of-life fiction, focusing on lighthearted, humorous plot lines centered on romantic ideas.

Director.Name: Marc Lawrence
Director.Bio: Marc Lawrence is an American director, screenwriter, and producer. Lawrence is best known for his numerous collaborations with Sandra Bullock and Hugh Grant.

Title: Jesus Christ Superstar
Description: A 1970 rock opera with music by Andrew Lloyd Webber and lyrics by Tim Rice. The story is loosely based on the Gospels' accounts of the last week of Jesus's life, beginning with the preparation for the arrival of Jesus and his disciples in Jerusalem and ending with the crucifixion. It depicts political and interpersonal struggles between Judas Iscariot and Jesus that are not present in the Bible.

Genre.Name: Drama
Genre.Description: Drama is a category of narrative fiction (or semi-fiction) intended to be more serious than humorous in tone.

Director.Name: Norman Jewison
Director.Bio: Norman Frederick Jewison is a Canadian retired film director, producer, screenwriter, and founder of the Canadian Film Centre.

Title: My Cousin Vinny
Description: Two New Yorkers accused of murder in rural Alabama while on their way back to college call in the help of one of their cousins, a loudmouth lawyer with no trial experience.

Genre.Name: Comedy
Genre.Description: Comedy is a story that tells about a series of funny, or comical events, intended to make the audience laugh.

Director.Name: Jonathan Lynn
Director.Bio: Jonathan Lynn is an English stage and film director, producer, writer, and actor.

Title: Uncle Buck
Description: Bachelor and all-round slob Buck babysits his brother's rebellious teenage daughter and her cute younger brother and sister.

Genre.Name: Comedy
Genre.Description: Comedy is a story that tells about a series of funny, or comical events, intended to make the audience laugh.

Director.Name: John Hughes
Director.Bio: John Wilden Hughes Jr was an American filmmaker. Most of Hughes's work is set in the Chicago metropolitan area. He is best known for his coming-of-age teen comedy films which often combined magic realism with honest depictions of suburban teenage life.

Title: Planes, Trains, and Automobiles
Description: A man must struggle to travel home for Thanksgiving with a lovable oaf of a shower curtain ring salesman as his only companion.

Genre.Name: Comedy
Genre.Description: Comedy is a story that tells about a series of funny, or comical events, intended to make the audience laugh.

Director.Name: John Hughes
Director.Bio: John Wilden Hughes Jr was an American filmmaker. Most of Hughes's work is set in the Chicago metropolitan area. He is best known for his coming-of-age teen comedy films which often combined magic realism with honest depictions of suburban teenage life.

Title: Big Fish
Description: A frustrated son tries to determine the fact from fiction in his dying father's life.

Genre.Name: Fantasy
Genre.Description: The fantasy genre is characterized by fantastic themes, usually magic, supernatural events, mythology, folklore, or exotic fantasy worlds.

Director.Name: Tim Burton
Director.Bio: Timothy Walter Burton is an American film director, producer, writer, and artist, known for his gothic fantasy and horror films.

Title: Get Out
Description: A young African-American visits his white girlfriend's parents for the weekend, where his simmering uneasiness about their reception of him eventually reaches a boiling point.

Genre.Name: Horror
Genre.Description: A horror film is one that seeks to elicit fear in its audience for entertainment purposes.[1] Horror films additionally aim to evoke viewers' nightmares, revulsions and terror of the unknown or the macabre.

Director.Name: Jordan Peele
Director.Bio: Jordan Haworth Peele is an American actor, comedian and filmmaker. He is best known for his television and film work in the comedy and horror genres.

Title: Hereditary
Description: A grieving family is haunted by tragic and disturbing occurrences.

Genre.Name: Horror
Genre.Description: A horror film is one that seeks to elicit fear in its audience for entertainment purposes.[1] Horror films additionally aim to evoke viewers' nightmares, revulsions and terror of the unknown or the macabre.

Director.Name: Ari Aster
Director.Bio: Ari Aster is a New York City director and writer. He is known for his seamless mix of horror and extremely dark humor and  unflinching depictions of graphic violence.

Title: Midsommar
Description: A couple travels to Scandinavia to visit a rural hometown's fabled Swedish mid-summer festival. What begins as an idyllic retreat quickly devolves into an increasingly violent and bizarre competition at the hands of a pagan cult.

Genre.Name: Horror
Genre.Description: A horror film is one that seeks to elicit fear in its audience for entertainment purposes.[1] Horror films additionally aim to evoke viewers' nightmares, revulsions and terror of the unknown or the macabre.

Director.Name: Ari Aster
Director.Bio: Ari Aster is a New York City director and writer. He is known for his seamless mix of horror and extremely dark humor and  unflinching depictions of graphic violence.

Title: Parasite
Description: Greed and class discrimination threaten the newly formed symbiotic relationship between the wealthy Park family and the destitute Kim clan.

Genre.Name: Drama
Genre.Description: Drama is a category of narrative fiction (or semi-fiction) intended to be more serious than humorous in tone.

Director.Name: Bong Joon Ho
Director.Bio: Bong Joon-ho is a South Korean film director, producer and screenwriter. His films are characterized by emphasis on social themes, genre-mixing, black humor, and sudden tone shifts.
